channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-106] memcache size reported in debug log doesn ot add up
item.description:
below shows a memcache size of 64M but when you add up the regions I get
149.3K = 152883.2B
153B = 153B
153B = 153B
3.8M = 3984588.8B
2.6M = 2726297.6B
153B = 153B
129K = 132096B
2.6M = 2726297.6B
153B = 153B

total = 9569891.4B = 9.12M not 64M

item.summary: memcache size reported in debug log doesn ot add up

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have other examples of this Billy (You don't need to do the calc., just paste the log snippet). I have loading tests running here but only one family and math comes out rine. I'm guessing has to do w/ multiple families. Thanks.

I did not add but these look a little off too just grabed from my logs

2008-01-22 01:04:35,954 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HStore: Added 540402979/rank_visual/4766710550905778780 with 0 entries, sequence id 48523706, and size 153.0 for 540402979/rank_visual

2008-01-22 01:04:35,954 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HRegion: Finished memcache flush for region webdata,,1200970130265 in 2250ms, sequenceid=48523706

I think the reason it doesn't add up is that there is either an optional cache flush going on or the region is being closed during a split. When a region is closed, what gets flushed is what ever is in the cache at the time.

In the current implementation, the caches are flushed when the total for all columns reaches 64M. The only other callers of cache flush are the optional timed cache flush and when a region is closed.

Optional cache flushing and zero length flushes will be removed in HADOOP-2636. Further, since cache flushing will be on a per column basis, cache flushing will only occur when the cache for that column reaches 64M.

there was no split on the above logs all one region never split.

The option flush might be the problem but not sure if thats what is causing my other issue (HADOOP-2673) or not if not then option flush should not be getting called note the flush times above

We should add debug logging to tell us what is calling the flush.

also no close happening all on the same server never closed or moved.

2008-01-21 23:51:55,944 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HStore: Added 540402979/in_rank/7235419568042410782 with 189726 entries, sequence id 32535827, and size 2.6m for 540402979/in_rank

is the size in this line the size of the mapfile or the size of the memcache flushed?

I use compression=block so this could be the difference if its the mapfile size.
The size reported is the mapfile size. In HADOOP-2636, it will be the size of the memcache.
Sizes are map file not memcache so mapfile sizes would not not equal the memcache size due to compression.
